hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant negative news catalyst (e.g., macro scare, large liquidation event) causes a sharp 1-hour price drop (>3%) on elevated volume (>1.5x 20-day avg), but the subsequent 4-hour candle closes with a lower wick >50% of the candle body (showing rejection), a long entry will capture a mean-reversion bounce as the initial overreaction is corrected, amplified by short covering.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Sharp negative reactions to news in non-bear regimes often overextend due to panic/liquidations. A clear rejection candle signals exhaustion of selling pressure. The bounce is amplified as leveraged shorts cover into strength and sidelined buyers perceive value.
entry_conditions: 1-hour BTC candle closes down >3% on volume >1.5x 20-day average
Catalyst identified (major news headline, large liquidation alert)
Next 4-hour candle must close with a lower wick >50% of its total body length
Entry at open of candle following the 4-hour rejection candle
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean return of strategy is <=0 over 20 instances, or win rate <55% with average loser >1.5x average winner.
